title: EXCHANGE  ---  CNN's Chris Cuomo Accused of Groping  ----  By Benjamin Mullin
text:
A veteran TV journalist said Friday that CNN anchor Chris Cuomo groped her in 2005 while they were both employees of Walt Disney Co.'s ABC News.

Shelley Ross said in an essay for the New York Times that she was attending a going-away party for a co-worker at a bar in Manhattan's Upper West Side neighborhood when Mr. Cuomo walked toward her, enveloped her in a strong bear hug "while lowering one hand to firmly grab and squeeze the cheek of my buttock."

She said that the incident occurred in front of her husband and that Mr. Cuomo promptly sent an email to apologize, saying he was "ashamed."

Mr. Cuomo said in a statement that the incident happened 16 years ago in a public setting when Ms. Ross was a top executive at ABC. He added that it wasn't sexual in nature."I apologized to her then, and I meant it," Mr. Cuomo said.

A spokeswoman for CNN had no immediate comment.

Mr. Cuomo has been in the headlines for his off-camera behavior. Earlier this year, Mr. Cuomo gave a lengthy on-air apology for participating in strategy sessions with advisers for his brother, then-New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, as the governor responded to multiple allegations of sexual assault.

CNN didn't discipline Mr. Cuomo, one of its biggest stars and the anchor of its "Cuomo Prime Time" 9 p.m. ET hour.

Jeff Zucker, the president of CNN, had said in a staff meeting that Mr. Cuomo's participation in the strategy sessions was inappropriate but had added that the network wouldn't discipline him, saying a suspension would amount to "punishment for the sake of punishing."
